alert.note: Alert for Finney; Hamilton; Hodgeman; Kearny; Pawnee (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 01 at 12:18PM CST until January 02 at 11:00AM CST by NWS Dodge City
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST /5 PM MST/ THIS EVENING... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT CST /11 PM MST/ TONIGHT TO 11 AM CST /10 AM MST/ SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to 1 inch. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 15 below zero. * WHERE...Hamilton, Finney, Hodgeman, Pawnee and Kearny Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 6 PM CST /5 PM MST/ this evening. For the Wind Chill Advisory, until noon CST /11 AM MST/ today. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The cold wind chills could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause primarily travel difficulties. Be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities...and use caution while driving. A Wind Chill Advisory means that very cold air and strong winds will combine to generate low wind chills. This will result in frost bite and lead to hypothermia if precautions are not taken. If you must venture outdoors...make sure you wear a hat and gloves.
